document.title: North Carolina Standard Course of Study

9EB128DCE5A54DE0B1636C6203E4BC4D.description: Recognize symmetry in a two-dimensional figure, and identify and draw lines of symmetry.

FF0E418F36E340F8A798A0D7E8E6B126.description: Classify quadrilaterals and triangles based on angle measure, side lengths, and the presence or absence of parallel or perpendicular lines.

F4247199F5F14E54B602B7E59209DF5C.description: Draw and identify points, lines, line segments, rays, angles, and perpendicular and parallel lines.

27F87DF64142453BBECF9F3B00AAED3B.description: Classify shapes based on lines and angles in two-dimensional figures.

9A1277E19CC64F19B68C779A1CCB0684.description: Solve addition and subtraction problems to find unknown angles on a diagram in real-world and mathematical problems.

8FFBB80C710841998CD83BCB331C8171.description: Measure and sketch angles in whole-number degrees using a protractor.

D1E4FCE40A4C4EF4BBA53EB56C964B3C.description: Understand angles as geometric shapes that are formed wherever two rays share a common endpoint, and are measured in degrees.

68492385B82E4D01BA74C9CE458EBBEE.description: Develop an understanding of angles and angle measurement.

2B9B9F04C3DA4DE3BB5CB9050D946FA3.description: Understand concepts of angle and measure angles.

8823A031CE6A4483880F2D8136FE85C9.description: Determine whether a survey question will yield categorical or numerical data.

EF797381D0E8486B9754A55390E2FDF1.description: Make a representation of data and interpret data in a frequency table, scaled bar graph, and/or line plot.

A6F0782DD1AA4CF7BBEF89055D072E55.description: Collect data by asking a question that yields numerical data.

E8FE56C249974565B9C48464E34ACA80.description: Represent and interpret data using whole numbers.

D684978C244949E68A4A64621A236C49.description: Apply the area and perimeter formulas for rectangles in real world and mathematical problems.

215424AE6C9B49BE98FC72CA5F41EE13.description: Solve problems involving a fixed area and varying perimeters and a fixed perimeter and varying areas.

FFD627AE4E6742CBB29091C129170762.description: Find areas of rectilinear figures with known side lengths.

BEBFFC1A5DA74900AE59CBDDD1C84B24.description: Solve problems with area and perimeter

51B82BDD958645B1AC6B7809920B4BAB.description: Solve problems involving area and perimeter.

2F2CFB8495B64268B11652054536B9F2.description: Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of time intervals that cross the hour.

02534E057967466F87051EBB3478C4AF.description: Use multiplicative reasoning to convert metric measurements from a larger unit to a smaller unit using place value understanding, twocolumn tables, and length models.

346D5D9A72084C0AA39B7B61143CBE82.description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide to solve one-step word problems involving whole-number measurements of length, mass, and capacity that are given in metric units.

5044E6E3A3BA4A61A9C4D92296016C6F.description: Measure to solve problems involving metric units: centimeter, meter, gram, kilogram, Liter, milliliter.

52A6FC28D12F448D90015EB5FE6DA4DC.description: Know relative sizes of measurement units. Solve problems involving metric measurement.

BB98995D8CB34C318F68739B198F6813.description: Compare two decimals to hundredths by reasoning about their size using area and length models, and recording the results of comparisons with the symbols >, =, or <. Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two decimals refer to the same whole.

3A8EEED0C3BC47DF97C2A7E8F8C28DD4.description: Represent tenths and hundredths with models, making connections between fractions and decimals.

432B913850D64A3A9EEDB220A69A4509.description: Use equivalent fractions to add two fractions with denominators of 10 or 100.

862BB38D861E443588CD8CB35D179458.description: Express, model and explain the equivalence between fractions with denominators of 10 and 100.

6053256058A649AFBD01BBA89B059786.description: Use decimal notation to represent fractions.

DE82DA71D3C148AB847CDBC7EA4F32A4.description: Understand decimal notation for fractions, and compare decimal fractions.

16E5CFC45B7D4F17B6980CA1F6B441A5.description: Solve word problems involving multiplication of a fraction by a whole number.

424BFC47996F40ABB2267C912606775A.description: Model and explain how fractions can be represented by multiplying a whole number by a unit fraction, using this understanding to multiply a whole number by any fraction less than one.

C8FBED0D7EC4486EAC97A0C3FEF8EA00.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to:

6A3AB9C934F8461EAD9ABBBB0D6E430E.description: Use unit fractions to understand operations of fractions.

E98332D952354AB993FDF1E61DC90B14.description: Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions, including mixed numbers by writing equations from a visual representation of the problem.

DF1753AE4CC74E49B54C8B29088BF415.description: Add and subtract fractions, including mixed numbers with like denominators, by replacing each mixed number with an equivalent fraction, and/or by using properties of operations and the relationship between addition and subtraction

F94B8AE7FB4A431D993E1170E576C9E2.description: Decompose a fraction into a sum of unit fractions and a sum of fractions with the same denominator in more than one way using area models, length models, and equations

785862D25462416588B87F6E586E10A6.description: Understand addition and subtraction of fractions as joining and separating parts referring to the same whole.

68CEDA7310ED4B238BE5AAE1009692A5.description: Understand and justify decompositions of fractions with denominators of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 12, and 100.

05C2F528105F46809044605FE9719533.description: Build fractions from unit fractions by applying and extending previous understandings of operations on whole numbers

FDF8B5EA95DB465AA0471B846FB834A7.description: Comparing common numerator or common denominators.

A7FC41B150844ACF864BBE740760CB81.description: Using benchmark fractions 0, Â½, and a whole.

89261E87599F42EBA5A72727EE11225A.description: Reasoning about their size and using area and length models.

1AA50CAB559E4D9FA9AE106F5C941725.description: Compare two fractions with different numerators and different denominators, using the denominators 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 12, and 100. Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two fractions refer to the same whole. Record the results of comparisons with symbols >, =, or <, and justify the conclusions by:

2AA67F03B07E4CD0B55714C5172FF2E3.description: Explain why a fraction is equivalent to another fraction by using area and length fraction models, with attention to how the number and size of the parts differ even though the two fractions themselves are the same size.

C663E103C2BD457FA4413476E6E14713.description: Find whole-number quotients and remainders with up to three-digit dividends and one-digit divisors with place value understanding using rectangular arrays, area models, repeated subtraction, partial quotients, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between multiplication and division.

3CEE41243F554FF59541A57010BACC4F.description: Multiply a whole number of up to three digits by a one-digit whole number, and multiply up to two two-digit numbers with place value understanding using area models, partial products, and the properties of operations. Use models to make connections and develop the algorithm.

C1722C2AC0A6481F91ACC9A140B1F7F8.description: Add and subtract multi-digit whole numbers up to and including 100,000 using the standard algorithm with place value understanding.

186A5B73C5394AC3A79F90EA20F83E36.description: Use place value understanding and properties of operations to perform multi-digit arithmetic

CF4E21DB44504C06BA7D0D2B30471081.description: Compare two multi-digit numbers up to and including 100,000 based on the values of the digits in each place, using >, =, and < symbols to record the results of comparisons.

34206FE2CBB74573B00432F1E31F8DCA.description: Read and write multi-digit whole numbers up to and including 100,000 using numerals, number names, and expanded form.

E2AE804502354D1BBC0ABB6124570946.description: Explain that in a multi-digit whole number, a digit in one place represents 10 times as much as it represents in the place to its right, up to 100,000.

A137344A46C043889E96E7AFBD84FFD0.description: Generalize place value understanding for multi-digit whole numbers.

45BE7ED3B7D84EBEB48455A7BBF33CEA.description: Number and Operations in Base Ten

26163CFB3C6446B9BFB3DC123EDE1497.description: Generate and analyze a number or shape pattern that follows a given rule.

31DC497011364E0E8CDE49C4C922991D.description: Determine if the number is prime or composite.

CE52D8D07A5447BCA60C6AAD51E6F8B8.description: Determine whether a given whole number is a multiple of a given one-digit number.

A186147124E5498CBAB31AFA5209F3DC.description: Recognize that a whole number is a multiple of each of its factors

DF9E7F8467A0460F8A7952F6AB8129C2.description: Find all factor pairs for whole numbers up to and including 50 to:

601C1BDEFF5744A48F5910D32C7378A5.description: Gain familiarity with factors and multiples.

4CC264E0F6E64214B2290D011A7B8E3C.description: Represent problems using equations with a letter standing for the unknown quantity.

AAFEB06D98544334A52AE9E367FD8163.description: Use estimation strategies to assess reasonableness of answers.

BE8D5622CCE5475A8B79A1D59372923B.description: Solve two-step word problems involving the four operations with whole numbers.

9FA68CAD5FBA43DF820110670272CEB4.description: Use the four operations with whole numbers to solve problems.

E9DADF2264C549F3B65AF5A8E8BBE2AF.description: Interpret a multiplication equation as a comparison. Multiply or divide to solve word problems involving multiplicative comparisons using models and equations with a symbol for the unknown number. Distinguish multiplicative comparison from additive comparison.

2F5FE2675A804E9AB2201767D57F6776.description: Represent and solve problems involving multiplication and division.

C583F4BE339B479A8C4DB094EAFE5F5E.description: Look for and express regularity in repeated reasoning.

BC2A3A74F4FC4626A30C72D66DA55AD3.description: Look for and make use of structure.

71CD4C89C27441A59F8DFC65E4302877.description: Construct viable arguments and critique the reasoning of others.

D9C5590A5C58477ABD4771C2D60A7CF6.description: Make sense of problems and persevere in solving them.

2666D9711DA24F969EEEBB5C6458ACBA.description: NC Standards Course of Study - Math Grade 4 (2018)
